page.title: 19Clacton Carnival Week
page.content: During Clacton Carnival Week, (usually the second week of August) the town is alive with people. It is one of the largest carnivals in the country in terms of events, and now lasts about a week and a half, with events on most days for some section of the public. The Carnival Committee is a purely charitable body who took over the organization of the events over twenty years ago, when it comprised of a procession and a fete only. Now there are about fifteen different events and they are constantly under review. The Carnival is becoming quite well known over a large area, and many visitors book their holidays every year to coincide with Carnival Week. The committee tries to help one main charity each year and donations are given to many local charities.
